result.execSummary:
The defendant Cameron Russel Adams was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Cameron Russel Adams is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Cameron Russel Adams was found guilty of Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).
  • Cameron Russel Adams was found guilty of Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).
  • Cameron Russel Adams was found guilty of 2nd-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
08-07/2018. Judge Dennis Cimpl   
The Court ordered restitution in the amount of $1,961.00, payable to Miladys R.

02-11-2016/ Judge Dennis Cimpl 
Parties stipulate to a total amount of restitution , due and owing, $1,961.00.
Restitution to be collected by the DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid during term of extended supervision.
Non-payment penalty shall result in a civil judgment. 


Joint and several with 15CF1369.  Hearing December 11, 2015.

Pay all of following by end of supervision.  Restitution in amount to be determined at hearing; joint and several with 15CF1369.  Pay DNA surcharges.  All to be paid through collection by DOC from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of Extended supervision.  DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
Court waived all court costs due to the amount of restitution to be imposed.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with counts three and 10; consecutive to 15CF781 and consecutive to any other sentence.

superMiscConds.notes: Seek and maintain full time employment.  Obtain a GED/HSED.

No further violations rising to the level of probable cause.
No possession of alcohol or illegal drugs.
No driving a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license.
No contact with victims.
No contact with codefendants.
AODA assessment. Cooperate with any treatment programs deemed necessary.  Random urine screens.

supervisions.notes: Court orders no other specific programming conditions.  Defendant must complete a Risk and Needs Assessment with DOC and comply with case plan goals related to prioritized need areas so identified.

Provide a  DNA sample.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm; also advised he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.

records.addlTxt:
Certification of transcript of proceedings of SENTENCING HEARING commencing NOVEMBER 10, 2015 received and filed. (30 Pages.)
Copy of transcript forwarded to INSTITUTION
SEE CASE NO. 15CF1369 for Request for payment of witness fees prepared by the DA's Victim/Witness Services dated 2/12/16 for Miladys R. for 1 appearance on 2/11/16.

Defendant Cameron Russel Adams in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant Cameron Russel Adams in custody.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Restitution hearing conducted.  Sworn as interpreter:  Enrique Barbosa.  Sworn:  Melandrisa R.  Parties stipulate to the following restitution:  $200.00 for CD's, $1,340.00 for vehicle, $300.00 for car seat and stroller, $120 for shoes for a total amount of restitution due and owing $1,961.00.  Restitution to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid during term of extended supervision; nonpayment penalty shall result in a civil judgment

Attorney Mary Garvin Guimont in court, defendant Cameron Russel Adams not in court, in custody.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Status conference on restitution proceeded.  There has been a language issue, victim is Spanish speaking.  Case adjourned for status on restitution hearing in Branch 19.  Restitution hearing scheduled for February 11, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Associated with Charge #10

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. 
As to Count 1:  The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 7 YEARS with 0 days credit CONCURRENT with Counts 3 & 10; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 3.5 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 3.5 YEARS.
As to Count 3:  The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 3.5 YEARS with 0 days credit CONCURRENT with Counts 1 & 10; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 1.5 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 YEARS.
As to Count 10:  The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 7 YEARS with 0 days credit CONCURRENT to Counts 1 & 3; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 3.5 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 3.5 YEARS.
These sentences are CONSECUTIVE to 15CF781 and CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence
Court finds defendant IS NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration program or the WI Substance Abuse program.

  Conditions of Extended Supervision:
- No further violations rising to the level of probable cause
- Cooperate with the Probation Department
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any treatment programs deemed necessary
- No possession of alcohol or illegal drugs
- Random urine screens
- Seek and maintain full-time employment
- Obtain a GED/HSED
- no driving a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license
- no contact with victims
- no contact with co-defendants
- Provide a DNA sample.
Court orders no other specific programming conditions.  Defendant must complete a risk and needs assessment with DOC and comply with case plan goals related to prioritized need areas so identified.

Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
Restitution in the amount to be determined at the restitution hearing in Branch 19.  Restitution to be joint and several with 15CF1369
Pay DNA surcharges;
Court waived all court costs due to the amount of restitution to be imposed.
-  No Cash Bail Posted in this matter 
-  The Court ordered that surcharges and restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm. 
Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.
Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.  

Filed:  
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence 
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Victim Impact Statements

As to Counts 1, 3 & 10:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  
As to Counts 2, 4 & 5:  Pursuant to negotiations and on motion of the State Court dismissed and read in the counts.
As to Count 9:  Pursuant to negotiations and on motion of the State Court dismissed the count.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  Court orders the defendant to provide a DNA sample.  Case is adjourned for sentencing in Branch 19.

Defendant Cameron Russel Adams in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant Cameron Russel Adams in custody.  Patrick Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Filed, original amended information; copy served on defendant.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of information, waives formal reading, pleads not guilty.  
Court ordered addition of Count 10,  2nd degree REcklessly Endangering Safety, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes sections 941(30(2), 939.50(3)(g) , a Class G Felony.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Mary Garvin Guimont in court, defendant Cameron R Adams not in court, in custody.  Patrick Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  On parties request Court grants one more adjounment.    Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch  19.  Plea hearing scheduled for September 23, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Mary Garvin Guimont in court, defendant Cameron R Adams not in court, in custody.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense requests plea and sentencing date.    All parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be assigned to Judge Dennis Cimpl, Branch 19, in Room 313 of the Safety Building due to rotation.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 20, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Mary Garvin Guimont in court, defendant Cameron Russel Adams not in court, in custody.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense requests  more time.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Mary Garvin Guimont in court, defendant Cameron R Adams not in court, in custody.  Irene Parthum for Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense requests more time.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 19, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Cameron Russel Adams in court with James Bowers, student intern under the supervision of Vince Guimont for attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant Cameron Russel Adams in custody.  Ron Dague for Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 16, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  
ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing.  No driving without a valid license or Insurance.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with: Co-Defendant: Asia Scott.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Cameron Russel Adams in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  
Defendant Cameron Russel Adams in custody.  
Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 7, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
